page.title: 11THE BAKERY
page.content: Here first impressions are clinical: the corridors and initial smell give the impression of a hospital. Overalls and head cover are compulsary for all workers and visiters. A total of 270 people work here, mainly women, of whom 9 are managerial staff. The 24 hour shifts are operated from 4am Sunday to 4pm Friday, each shift lasting 8 hours. In 1985 by far the most popular types of bread are the high-fibre loaves. The area covered by delivery of foods produced by this depot covers all Kent and parts of Sussex as far East as Eastbourne. Rate of pay is low, 2 pounds per hour for shop floor personnel but there is ample opportunity for overtime. Managerial pay ranges from 8-16,000 pounds per annum. Normal holiday is 3 weeks plus Bank holidays
